meanings.sent1: Climbing Mount Everest was the gnarliest challenge of his life.
meanings.sent2: The final level of the video game was the gnarliest one yet.
meanings.sent3: Trying to juggle ten balls at once was the gnarliest thing I've ever attempted.
meanings.sent4: Her gnarliest opponent in the chess tournament turned out to be a 10-year-old prodigy.
meanings.sent5: The gnarliest part of the obstacle course was the mud pit filled with giant rocks.

meanings.definition: Gnarliest (adverb): in a manner that is extreme or intense
meanings.sent1: He skated gnarliest down the steep hill, impressing everyone with his skills.
meanings.sent2: She sang gnarliest during the concert, hitting all the high notes perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The chef chopped vegetables gnarliest, making it look like a work of art.
meanings.sent4: The storm raged gnarliest, causing trees to sway dangerously in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The roller coaster twisted and turned gnarliest, thrilling all the riders on board.
